metadata.title: CVE-2019-3016 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In a Linux KVM guest that has PV TLB enabled, a process in the guest kernelmay be able to read memory locations from another process in the sameguest. This problem is limit to the host running linux kernel 4.10 with aguest running linux kernel 4.16 or later. The problem mainly affects AMDprocessors but Intel CPUs cannot be ruled out.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
